channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Sampling is Matter: Point-guided 3D Human Mesh Reconstruction
item.description: Even though those approaches have shown the remarkable progress in 3D human mesh reconstruction, it is still difficult to directly infer the relationship between features, which are encoded from the 2D input image, and 3D coordinates of each vertex.

item.title: TieFake: Title-Text Similarity and Emotion-Aware Fake News Detection
item.description: We also propose a scale-dot product attention mechanism to capture the similarity between title features and textual features.

item.title: Bridging RL Theory and Practice with the Effective Horizon
item.description: We find that prior bounds do not correlate well with when deep RL succeeds vs. fails, but discover a surprising property that does.

item.title: A Survey of Corpora for Germanic Low-Resource Languages and Dialects
item.description: In this work, we instead focus on low-resource languages and in particular non-standardized low-resource languages.

item.title: Disentangling Neuron Representations with Concept Vectors
item.description: Mechanistic interpretability aims to understand how models store representations by breaking down neural networks into interpretable units.

item.title: Enhancing Multi-Camera People Tracking with Anchor-Guided Clustering and Spatio-Temporal Consistency ID Re-Assignment
item.description: Multi-camera multiple people tracking has become an increasingly important area of research due to the growing demand for accurate and efficient indoor people tracking systems, particularly in settings such as retail, healthcare centers, and transit hubs.

item.title: Density-Insensitive Unsupervised Domain Adaption on 3D Object Detection
item.description: Recently, few works attempt to tackle the domain gap in objects, but still fail to adapt to the gap of varying beam-densities between two domains, which is critical to mitigate the characteristic differences of the LiDAR collectors.

item.title: Any-to-Any Style Transfer
item.description: Existing approaches either apply the holistic style of the style image in a global manner, or migrate local colors and textures of the style image to the content counterparts in a pre-defined way.

item.title: Boosting Semantic Segmentation with Semantic Boundaries
item.description: Motivated by the recent development in improving semantic segmentation by incorporating boundaries as auxiliary tasks, we propose a multi-task framework that uses semantic boundary detection (SBD) as an auxiliary task.

item.title: Learning Resource Scheduling with High Priority Users using Deep Deterministic Policy Gradients
item.description: Advances in mobile communication capabilities open the door for closer integration of pre-hospital and in-hospital care processes.

item.title: AMT: All-Pairs Multi-Field Transforms for Efficient Frame Interpolation
item.description: It is based on two essential designs.

item.title: Multi-scale Adaptive Fusion Network for Hyperspectral Image Denoising
item.description: Two key components contribute to improving the hyperspectral image denoising: A progressively multiscale information aggregation network and a co-attention fusion module.

item.title: CMID: A Unified Self-Supervised Learning Framework for Remote Sensing Image Understanding
item.description: We argue that this learning strategy is suboptimal in the realm of RS, since the required representations for different RS downstream tasks are often varied and complex.

item.title: https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.09797
item.description: The performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in reasoning tasks depends heavily on prompt design, with Chain-of-Thought (CoT) and self-consistency being critical methods that enhance this ability.

item.title: Rank-Based Learning and Local Model Based Evolutionary Algorithm for High-Dimensional Expensive Multi-Objective Problems
item.description: In this work, a novel Classifier-assisted rank-based learning and Local Model based multi-objective Evolutionary Algorithm (CLMEA) is proposed for high-dimensional expensive multi-objective optimization problems.

item.title: Rehabilitation Exercise Repetition Segmentation and Counting using Skeletal Body Joints
item.description: This paper presents a novel approach for segmenting and counting the repetitions of rehabilitation exercises performed by patients, based on their skeletal body joints.

item.title: Chameleon: Plug-and-Play Compositional Reasoning with Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved remarkable progress in various natural language processing tasks with emergent abilities.

item.title: Pointerformer: Deep Reinforced Multi-Pointer Transformer for the Traveling Salesman Problem
item.description: Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP), as a classic routing optimization problem originally arising in the domain of transportation and logistics, has become a critical task in broader domains, such as manufacturing and biology.

item.title: Investigating the Nature of 3D Generalization in Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Modern deep learning architectures for object recognition generalize well to novel views, but the mechanisms are not well understood.

item.title: Transformer-Based Visual Segmentation: A Survey
item.description: Recently, transformers, a type of neural network based on self-attention originally designed for natural language processing, have considerably surpassed previous convolutional or recurrent approaches in various vision processing tasks.

item.title: LipsFormer: Introducing Lipschitz Continuity to Vision Transformers
item.description: In contrast to previous practical tricks that address training instability by learning rate warmup, layer normalization, attention formulation, and weight initialization, we show that Lipschitz continuity is a more essential property to ensure training stability.

item.title: Learning Robust Visual-Semantic Embedding for Generalizable Person Re-identification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Multi-Modal Equivalent Transformer called MMET for more robust visual-semantic embedding learning on visual, textual and visual-textual tasks respectively.

item.title: Evaluating Verifiability in Generative Search Engines
item.description: Generative search engines directly generate responses to user queries, along with in-line citations.

item.title: Learnable Earth Parser: Discovering 3D Prototypes in Aerial Scans
item.description: Our goal is to provide a practical tool for analyzing 3D scenes with unique characteristics in the context of aerial surveying and mapping, without relying on application-specific user annotations.

item.title: MPMQA: Multimodal Question Answering on Product Manuals
item.description: Taking into account the length of product manuals and the fact that a question is always related to a small number of pages, MPMQA can be naturally split into two subtasks: retrieving most related pages and then generating multimodal answers.

item.title: Language Models Enable Simple Systems for Generating Structured Views of Heterogeneous Data Lakes
item.description: Code synthesis is cheap, but far less accurate than directly processing each document with the LLM.

item.title: Controlling keywords and their positions in text generation
item.description: In this paper, we tackle a novel task of controlling not only keywords but also the position of each keyword in the text generation.

item.title: Approximate non-linear model predictive control with safety-augmented neural networks
item.description: Our method requires a single evaluation of the NN and forward integration of the input sequence online, which is fast to compute on resource-constrained systems.

item.title: Optimizing Carbon Storage Operations for Long-Term Safety
item.description: In this study, we address these issues by modeling the decision-making process for carbon storage operations as a partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP).

item.title: An Offline Metric for the Debiasedness of Click Models
item.description: We prove that debiasedness is a necessary condition for recovering unbiased and consistent relevance scores and for the invariance of click prediction under covariate shift.

item.title: Big-Little Adaptive Neural Networks on Low-Power Near-Subthreshold Processors
item.description: This paper investigates the energy savings that near-subthreshold processors can obtain in edge AI applications and proposes strategies to improve them while maintaining the accuracy of the application.

item.title: Information Geometrically Generalized Covariate Shift Adaptation
item.description: In particular, the phenomenon that the marginal distribution of the data changes is called covariate shift, one of the most important research topics in machine learning.

item.title: Frequency Enhanced Hybrid Attention Network for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: However, many recent studies represent that current self-attention based models are low-pass filters and are inadequate to capture high-frequency information.

item.title: Neural Architecture Search for Visual Anomaly Segmentation
item.description: This paper presents AutoPatch, the first application of neural architecture search to the complex task of segmenting visual anomalies.

item.title: Deep Unrestricted Document Image Rectification
item.description: To our best knowledge, this is the first learning-based method for the rectification of unrestricted document images.

item.title: CodeKGC: Code Language Model for Generative Knowledge Graph Construction
item.description: However, large generative language model trained on structured data such as code has demonstrated impressive capability in understanding natural language for structural prediction and reasoning tasks.

item.title: Masked Language Model Based Textual Adversarial Example Detection
item.description: To explore how to use the masked language model in adversarial detection, we propose a novel textual adversarial example detection method, namely Masked Language Model-based Detection (MLMD), which can produce clearly distinguishable signals between normal examples and adversarial examples by exploring the changes in manifolds induced by the masked language model.

item.title: Unveiling and unraveling aggregation and dispersion fallacies in group MCDM
item.description: We also discuss the errors in computing measures of dispersion, including standard deviation and distance functions.

item.title: Learning Situation Hyper-Graphs for Video Question Answering
item.description: The proposed method is trained in an end-to-end manner and optimized by a VQA loss with the cross-entropy function and a Hungarian matching loss for the situation graph prediction.

item.title: Robustness of Visual Explanations to Common Data Augmentation
item.description: As the use of deep neural networks continues to grow, understanding their behaviour has become more crucial than ever.

item.title: Learning to Fuse Monocular and Multi-view Cues for Multi-frame Depth Estimation in Dynamic Scenes
item.description: To let the geometric perception learned from multi-view cues in static areas propagate to the monocular representation in dynamic areas and let monocular cues enhance the representation of multi-view cost volume, we propose a cross-cue fusion (CCF) module, which includes the cross-cue attention (CCA) to encode the spatially non-local relative intra-relations from each source to enhance the representation of the other.

item.title: Data and Knowledge Co-driving for Cancer Subtype Classification on Multi-Scale Histopathological Slides
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Data and Knowledge Co-driving (D&K) model to replicate the process of cancer subtype classification on a histopathological slide like a pathologist.

item.title: Saliency-aware Stereoscopic Video Retargeting
item.description: We use 1D convolution for shifting the salient objects and design a stereo video Transformer to assist the retargeting process.

item.title: A Comparison of Image Denoising Methods
item.description: In this paper, to investigate the applicability of existing denoising techniques, we compare a variety of denoising methods on both synthetic and real-world datasets for different applications.

item.title: Dynamic Coarse-to-Fine Learning for Oriented Tiny Object Detection
item.description: Despite the exploration of adaptive label assignment in recent oriented object detectors, the extreme geometry shape and limited feature of oriented tiny objects still induce severe mismatch and imbalance issues.

item.title: MER 2023: Multi-label Learning, Modality Robustness, and Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Over the past few decades, multimodal emotion recognition has made remarkable progress with the development of deep learning.

item.title: Revisiting k-NN for Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: Pre-trained Language Models (PLMs), as parametric-based eager learners, have become the de-facto choice for current paradigms of Natural Language Processing (NLP).

item.title: You Only Need Two Detectors to Achieve Multi-Modal 3D Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: Firstly, a new multi-object tracking framework is proposed in this paper based on multi-modal fusion.

item.title: Looking Through the Glass: Neural Surface Reconstruction Against High Specular Reflections
item.description: To remedy this issue, we present a novel surface reconstruction framework, NeuS-HSR, based on implicit neural rendering.

item.title: Phase-Retrieval with Incomplete Autocorrelations Using Deep Convolutional Autoencoders
item.description: Phase-retrieval techniques aim to recover the original signal from just the modulus of its Fourier transform, which is usually much easier to measure than its phase, but the standard iterative techniques tend to fail if only part of the modulus information is available.
